current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the issuance and sale of a semipostal by
		  the United States Postal Service to support effective programs targeted at
		  improving permanency outcomes for youth in foster care.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Families for Foster Youth Stamp Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, for a period of
			 not less than 4 years, provide for the issuance and sale of a semipostal, in
			 accordance with

text.#text:
In order to increase
			 funding for effective programs targeted at improving permanency outcomes for
			 youth in foster care, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for programs and activities
			 authorized under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
Fifty percent of any amounts becoming
			 available from the sale of the semipostal under this Act shall be transferred
			 to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that specifically target
			 improvement in permanency outcomes for youth in foster care through adoption,
			 guardianship, or kinship care.
